did.abstract: The collection consists audio oral history interview detailing experience of Thomas L. Bengtson as he served in the U.S. Marine Corps toward the end of Vietnam War and few years after. He worked on radar and fire control systems for aircraft in Marine Fighter Attack Squadron 235 (VMFA-235)
did.physloc: Center for Public Policy and Social Research (CPPSR) 207 DiLoreto Hall, Central Connecticut State University (CCSU) 1615 Stanley St. New Britain, CT 06050

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Thomas Bengston joined the United States Marine Corps in 1974 and attended basic training in San Diego, CA. Bengston describes basic training as similar to what is seen in films that depict Marine Corps induction. He served in Japan and Korea, where he worked on radar and fire control systems for aircraft. In the interview Bengston also answers questions regarding food, supplies, stress, entertainment, humorous events, and friends made in the marines. He was discharged in 1978 in Hawaii, where he lived and went to school using the GI bill after his service.
